wikipedia_page.main: Beatrice Emma Parsons (1870–1955) was a British painter and is best known for her watercolours of garden subjects. Parsons, along with George Samuel Elgood and Ernest Arthur Rowe, is considered one of the leading English painters of gardens.

response: One of Parsons’ older sisters was the artist Beatrice Emma Parsons (1869–1955). Beatrice worked for a while in Christopher Whall’s studio and when Parsons left school, Beatrice persuaded Whall to take him on as an apprentice.  Whall it seems saw promise in Parsons' sketches.  Apart from starting with Whall as a pupil-apprentice at Whall’s Hammersmith studio, he also worked at Lowndes and Drury in Chelsea, this under Whall’s supervision.  He also attended Whall’s classes at the L.C.C. Central School of Arts & Crafts.
